com.astamuse.asta4d.web.form.flow.ext

Interface MultiInputStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T extends MultiInputStepForm>

  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Superinterfaces:
    BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>, CascadeArrayFunctions, ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>, FormFlowTraceDataAccessor, UpdatableFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>, ValidationProcessor

    public interface MultiInputStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T extends MultiInputStepForm>
extends ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>
    For a form flow with multiple input steps, there are something different from the classical single input step form flow:
    • We store the trace data from the first step for later using
    • We set the initial form data for each input step by copying the initial step(before first) form data
    • We combine the form data of each step to one single instance for confirm page rendering and later process
    • We validate the corresponding sub form instance of each input step rather than the parent form instance
    Author:
    e-ryu

      • skipStoreTraceData

        default boolean skipStoreTraceData(String currentStep,
                                   String renderTargetStep,
                                   FormFlowTraceData traceData)
        Description copied from interface: ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait
        In the parent class BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait's implementation of saveTraceMap, it says that the sub class have the responsibility to make sure save the trace map well, thus we override it to perform the obligation. The trace map will not be saved when the flowing cases:
        • The form flow starts and the first step is shown as the entry of current flow
        • The form flow is returned to the first step from the first step (usually validation failed).
        • The form flow is returned to the first step from other step when the #skipSaveTraceMapWhenBackedFromOtherStep() returns true
        • The form flow has finished and is moving to the finish step.
        From parent:

        Since we are lacking of necessary step information to judge if we should save or not, we only do the basic judgment for the init step. The sub class have the responsibility to handle other cases.

        Specified by:
        skipStoreTraceData in interface ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T extends MultiInputStepForm>
        Specified by:
        skipStoreTraceData in interface FormFlowTraceDataAccessor
        See Also:
        ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait#skipSaveTraceData(String, String, FormFlowTraceData)
